paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the aggregation of transthyretin (TTR) in yeast models, focusing on the interaction with yeast prion proteins. It mentions a specific engineered TTR variant but does not provide detailed clinical or penetrance data for human cases.

functional_data.summary: The M-TTR-GFP variant (F87M/L110M) was engineered to study aggregation in yeast. It showed increased aggregation compared to WT-TTR-GFP, especially in the presence of the yeast prion [PSI+].

variants.additional_notes: The study focuses on the interaction of TTR with yeast prions, not on human clinical data.
key_quotes: We established aggregation of an engineered double (F87M/L110M) mutant M-TTR-GFP in yeast.
Aggregation of M-TTR-GFP was significantly enhanced in presence of [PSI+], an endogenous prion form of Sup35.

challenges: No human clinical or penetrance data provided for TTR variants.
extraction_metadata.notes: The paper primarily focuses on experimental data in yeast models, with no human genetic or clinical data available.
